Description: Ostracon, fragment of the handle of a pale-red pottery wine-jar, the fabric is grey in section, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip, the top of the handle is impressed with a stamp, comprising a cartouche containing the hieroglyphic formula - 'house of Aten in Iunu (=Heliopolis)' - which is overlaid with a darker-brown slip.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393420) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393420)
Associated places: Named in inscription: House of the Aten at Iunu (historic)
